text: [Music]
hi guys I'm Laura Vitale and this
episode of Laura in the kitchen I'm
gonna show you how to make one of my

shrimp and cannellini bean salad easy
healthy delicious budget-friendly
we love that so to make this recipe
you're gonna need a half a pound of
fresh shrimp peeled deveined one 15
ounce can of cannellini beans rinsed
you're gonna need two pieces of celery
chopped 1 clove of garlic fresh chopped
parsley extra virgin olive oil white
wine vinegar salt and pepper super easy
recipe and takes a very few ingredients
and so so good now first thing we do is
take a grill pan or if you want to this
outdoors you definitely can but it's

gonna use the indoor grill pan today I'm

pepper this drizzle it with just a touch
of olive oil so they don't stick to the
grill not much though that'd be good
give this a toss now that our my shrimp
tossed together I'm gonna put these on
the grill
and I'm gonna cook them the grill is
preheated to high heat and I'm gonna
cook these for about 3 minutes on each
side or until cooked all the way through
and I'm telling you do don't take very
long at all so keep an eye on them
otherwise it will overcook and become
very rubbery now I pull my shrimp off

a few minutes while I make the whole
like put the whole side together I'm

I don't want it in big pieces otherwise
it's going to cut out all the power and

like that put it into our Bowl yeah in
this bowl we're also gonna add the

not the outer to the arrow stocks
because there are more tough and not as

it's white wine vinegar it's kind of
great tastes very tangy but doesn't have
like a lot of flavor balsamic vinegar
would just not be the right thing for it
but any vinegar you have on hand and you

it's a great oil to use when you're
